alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ascension; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. John The Baptist, southeastern Ascension, St. James, west central St. Charles and north central Lafourche Parishes through 645 PM CDT... At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lutcher, or 11 miles southeast of Gonzales, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thibodaux, Gramercy, Lutcher, Paradis, South Vacherie, Convent, North Vacherie, Garyville, Wallace, Chackbay, Edgard, Des Allemands and Bayou Gauche. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 187 and 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm has a history of producing damaging winds and large hail but has since weakened. Be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service in the event that the storm re-intensifies. If on or near Lac des Allemands, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for portions of southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ascension; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche
